cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 370 mi ESE of Port O'Connor, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking west-northwest across the north-western Gulf toward the mid-Texas coast near Matagorda Bay/Port O’Connor
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor–Matagorda Bay, Texas coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: San Luis Pass to High Island, TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Mansfield to San Luis Pass, TX (includes Calhoun Port/Port O’Connor area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward past High Island, including the mid-Texas coast near Calhoun Port Authority
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) expected Friday night into Saturday as the center nears landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated water levels of 3 ft or slightly higher possible along the mid-Texas coast including Matagorda and Lavaca Bays, producing minor coastal flooding around Calhoun Port.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall of 3–5 inches with isolated pockets up to 10 inches could cause flash flooding and rises on small rivers/streams in the port’s vicinity.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents will affect vessel approach channels; reduced visibilities in squalls can hamper navigation and cargo operations.
